page.title: 19Schoolday in Watford. (3)
page.content: I bring a packed lunch to eat as my mum has 3 children and she can't afford a school dinner for us all. A dinner cooked in school costs 66p. 2 children in my class have school dinners and 2 go home. Children who eat in school can have a bottle of milk. We enjoy alternate Thursday afternoons because we travel by coach to a local sports field for games as we have no grass on our premises. Our school was built in 1907 and is now being refurbished. We have builders in and eventually our school will look more attractive. We leave school at 3.30pm. Many children go to Cubs or Brownies after tea. Every Thursday I receive pocket money when Dad returns from work. Luckily he has a job again. A few months ago he was made redundant. This has happened to 8 parents in my class. I get 50p and buy sweets, a magazine and save 10p.
